comments:
Build ID: M20061129-0800

Steps To Reproduce:
I got an NPE in the console window when I change the Web service type combo between the two Bottom Up and Top Down options.  The error does not prevent the user from continuing, nor is there any indication of a problem in the UI (nor subsequently).

To reproduce:
1. Launch WTP with -consoleLog in a new workspace, open the Windows->preferences dialog.
2. Select Web Services -> Scenario Defaults.
3. Change the type to Top Down Web service, and look at the console.

Here's the error stack I got.

More information:

In other words the exception appears to only be causing some noise in the console window? In that case, not a service release candidate, but something messy to clean up in WTP 2.0. Reducing severity. If I've misunderstood and there is more damage being done, please advise. Thanks - CB.

Created an attachment (id=58285)
patch for jst.ws.creation.ui

The NPE occurs because the listener attached to the scenario type drop-down box is trying to access the service impl/def'n field which does not exist on the preference page. 

Our code actually depends on this NPE to occur right now; there's code after the line that throws this NPE to validate other values on the ServerWizardWidget which are not shown on the preference page.  These steps would likely throw other exceptions if they are run.

This patch adds a check for the preferencesPage_ variable.  If the value is true it will return from the listener without running the code that accesses the non-preference page widgets.
Patch reviewed and committed. Will release later on today.
Patch released to WTP 2.0 as v200705022145.
